definitions.definition: to have as a necessary consequence ; to lead to (something) as a consequence
examples: The proposition that "all dogs are mammals" implies that my dog is a mammal.
When I state that your dog is brown, I am not implying that all dogs are brown.

definitions.definition: to hint ; to insinuate ; to suggest tacitly and avoid a direct statement
examples: What do you mean "we need to be more careful with hygiene"? Are you implying that I don't wash my hands?
definitions.label_groups: transitive , of a person or proposition

main_definition: ( transitive , of a proposition ) to have as a necessary consequence ; to lead to (something) as a consequence
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , of a person ) to suggest by logical inference
( transitive , of a person or proposition ) to hint ; to insinuate ; to suggest tacitly and avoid a direct statement
